briefdescription.para: A type for sizes.
A type for the geometric traits associated with the Delaunay graph.
A type for the underlying triangulation data structure.

detaileddescription.para: It must be a model of the concept TriangulationDataStructure_2.

briefdescription.para: A type for the vertices of the Delaunay graph.
A type for the faces of the Delaunay graph.
The type of the edges of the Delaunay graph.
Handle to the vertices of the Delaunay graph.
Handle to the faces of the Delaunay graph.

description.para: The following iterators and circulators must be defined.
All iterators and circulators must be assignable and convertible to their corresponding handles.

briefdescription.para: A type for an iterator over all edges of the Delaunay graph.

detaileddescription.para: Its value type must be Edge.

briefdescription.para: A type for an iterator over the finite edges of the Delaunay graph.

detaileddescription.para: Its value type must be Edge.

briefdescription.para: A type for an iterator over all faces of the Delaunay graph.

detaileddescription.para: Its value type must be Face.

briefdescription.para: A type for an iterator over the finite faces of the Delaunay graph.

detaileddescription.para: Its value type must be Face.

briefdescription.para: A type for an iterator over all vertices of the Delaunay graph.

detaileddescription.para: Its value type must be Vertex.

briefdescription.para: A type for an iterator over the finite vertices of the Delaunay graph.

detaileddescription.para: Its value type must be Vertex.

briefdescription.para: A type for a circulator over the adjacent faces of a vertex of the Delaunay graph.

detaileddescription.para: Its value type must be Face.

briefdescription.para: A type for a circulator over the adjacent vertices of a vertex of the Delaunay graph.

detaileddescription.para: Its value type must be Vertex.

briefdescription.para: A type for a circulator over the adjacent edges of a vertex of the Delaunay graph.

detaileddescription.para: Its value type must be Edge.

description.para: In addition to the default and copy constructors, as well as the assignment operator, the following constructors are required.

briefdescription.para: Constructor that takes an instance of the geometric traits.
Constructor that takes an iterator range.

detaileddescription.para: The value type of the iterator must be the type of the sites of the Delaunay graph.

briefdescription.para: Constructor that takes an iterator range and an instance of the geometric traits.

detaileddescription.para: The value type of the iterator must be the type of the sites of the Delaunay graph.

briefdescription.para: Returns a reference to the underlying triangulation data structure.
Returns a reference to the geometric traits object.
Returns a handle to the infinite vertex.
Returns a handle to a finite vertex, provided there exists one.
Returns a handle to a face incident to the infinite vertex.
Returns the dimension of the Delaunay graph.
Returns the number of finite vertices.
Returns the number of faces (both finite and infinite).

sectiondef.header: Finite Face, Edge and Vertex Iterators

description.para: The following iterators must allow, respectively, to visit finite faces, finite edges and finite vertices of the Delaunay graph.
These iterators must be non-mutable, bidirectional and their value types are respectively Face, Edge and Vertex.

briefdescription.para: Starts at an arbitrary finite vertex.
Past-the-end iterator.
Starts at an arbitrary finite edge.
Past-the-end iterator.
Starts at an arbitrary finite face.
Past-the-end iterator.

sectiondef.header: All Face, Edge and Vertex Iterators

description.para: The following iterators must allow, respectively, to visit all (both finite and infinite) faces, edges and vertices of the Delaunay graph.
These iterators are non-mutable, bidirectional and their value types are respectively Face, Edge and Vertex.

briefdescription.para: Starts at an arbitrary vertex.
Past-the-end iterator.
Starts at an arbitrary edge.
Past-the-end iterator.
Starts at an arbitrary face.
Past-the-end iterator.

description.para: A model of the DelaunayGraph_2 concept must also provide circulators that allow to visit, respectively, all faces or edges incident to a given vertex or all vertices adjacent to a given vertex.
These circulators are non-mutable and bidirectional. The operator operator++ must move the circulator counterclockwise around the vertex while the operator- must move the circulator clockwise.

briefdescription.para: Starts at an arbitrary face incident to v.
Starts at face f.

simplesect.para: Face f must be incident to vertex v.

briefdescription.para: Starts at an arbitrary edge incident to v.
Starts at the first edge of f incident to v, in counterclockwise order around v.

simplesect.para: Face f must be incident to vertex v.

briefdescription.para: Starts at an arbitrary vertex incident to v.
Starts at the first vertex of f adjacent to v in counterclockwise order around v.

simplesect.para: Face f must be incident to vertex v.

description.para: A model of the DelaunayGraph_2 concept must provide methods to test the finite or infinite character of any feature.

briefdescription.para: true, iff v is the infinite_vertex.
true, iff face f is infinite.
true, iff edge (f,i) is infinite.
true, iff edge e is infinite.
true, iff edge *ec is infinite.
Checks the validity of the Delaunay graph.

detaileddescription.para: If verbose is true a short message is sent to std::cerr.

briefdescription.para: Clears all contents of the Delaunay graph.
The Delaunay graphs other and dg are swapped.

detaileddescription.para: dg.swap(other) should be preferred to dg= other or to dg(other) if other is deleted afterwards.

briefdescription.para: The concept DelaunayGraph_2 defines the requirements for the first template parameter of the Voronoi_diagram_2<DG,AT,AP> class. The DelaunayGraph_2 concept essentially defines the requirements that a class representing a Delaunay graph must obey so that the Voronoi diagram adaptor can adapt it.

detaileddescription.para: A model of the DelaunayGraph_2 concept must provide several iterators and circulators that allow to traverse it (completely or partially). All iterators and circulators must be convertible to the corresponding handles.

listitem.para: CGAL::Triangulation_hierarchy_2<Tr> provided that Tr is a model of DelaunayGraph_2
